issue.title: [question] Why are there several numbered versions?

content.raw:
I have a feeling you need this library because another application, such as gazebo, requires ignition-math. If so, then you should first check to see what version is required by the downstream application. We can help you out with version requirement information, just let us know what your end goal is.

If you just need ign-math, then the lastest (highest), one is usually the best. Something to keep in mind are dependencies of ign-math itself. For example, version 6 of ign-math requires version 17 of the c++ standard which is available in Ubuntu Bionic but not in Ubuntu Xenial.
content.html:
I have a feeling you need this library because another application, such as gazebo, requires ignition-math. If so, then you should first check to see what version is required by the downstream application. We can help you out with version requirement information, just let us know what your end goal is.

If you just need ign-math, then the lastest (highest), one is usually the best. Something to keep in mind are dependencies of ign-math itself. For example, version 6 of ign-math requires version 17 of the c++ standard which is available in Ubuntu Bionic but not in Ubuntu Xenial.
